attributes.action: establish in law under what circumstances a Prime Minister must resign; not having a set of rules and leaving the decision up to the Prime Minister makes a mockery of our constitutional democracy.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Reasons for an individual Prime Minister to resign could be deemed to be any, or a combination, of the following:

 - Misleading the House of Commons

 - Taking the country into an illegal war

 - dodgy party fundraising

Indeed there may well be (and indeed prabably are) other grounds that should also be considered.

For the good of British democracy, and the people's trust in the political process, it is important for the Prime Minister to set out a clear set of rules against which all Prime Ministers may be held accountable.

reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
